pageContent: Background: This study was performed to evaluate the efficacy of radical prostatectomy for men with clinically localized, poorly differentiated (Gleason score > or = 7) prostate cancer and to characterize further the prognostic significance of traditional pathologic variables. The effectiveness of adjuvant radiotherapy was assessed in a subpopulation of men for whom the pathologic assessment suggested a high risk of persistent disease.

metaData.source:
Prostate cancer in the African American: is this a different disease?
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/9858329/
